JobFullDesc: About the RoleInternal auditing is an independent, objective assurance and consulting activity designed to add value and improve an organization's operations. It helps an organization accomplish its objectives by bringing a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of risk management, control, and governance processes. The Internal Audit Risk Architect:Performs advanced-level internal auditing work and executes Internal Audit projects.Maintains all organizational and professional ethical standards, and ensures Internal Audit activities are carried out in compliance with The IIA’s International Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing.Works autonomously and cross-functionally to advise products & engineering teams from conception to launch, connecting both the technical and business worlds, to adopt world class development practices that embrace velocity, reliability and user delight.What You'll DoDemonstrate very effective leadership in various areas of results, self and people leadershipEnsure operational excellence and deliver work on time and at optimal quality; this includes:Performance of audit procedures, and the use of adequate methodology, tools, and techniques.Effective identification, development, and documentation of audit issues, identification of root cause and negotiation of effective solutions.Effective and timely stakeholder relationship building and communication throughout all stages of the audit from planning to reporting to peers, stakeholders and IA management.Ongoing self quality control over the work performed (project documentation and deliverables).Develop and maintain productive stakeholder, team-oriented management and staff relationships.Pursue professional development opportunities, including external and internal training and professional association memberships, and share information gained with co-workersPerform related work as assigned by the Director/Senior Manager of Internal AuditBasic Qualifications6+ years of experience in internal audit, product management, or related industry experience.Experience creating product roadmaps from conception to launch, driving the product vision, defining go-to-market strategy, and leading design discussions.Experience of going through a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritisation and pre/post-launch execution.Proficient in SQL. Experience of other languages such as Python, Go, Java is a plus.Problem solving skills that demonstrate critical thinking and “outside-the-box” approach to reach a solution.Communication (both written and verbal), interpersonal, and presentation experience that allow interactions with business partners.Experience in operating independently in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while leading multiple projects/initiatives.Preferred QualificationsBA/BS in relevant fields.CIA/CISA/CISSP/CCSP certification.Understanding of Uber’s products and operations.Industry experience within Technology, E-Commerce, Rideshare, Food Delivery, Retail, Financial (Payments) a plus.Experience experience working with teams involved in DevOps, continuous integration/continuous deployment, build pipeline, release management, production engineering and architectural design reviews of home-grown systems.Experience with building and maintaining programs based on well-known standards (such as ISO27001, ITIL v4 etc).Experience in using Data science and data analytics when conducting audit projects (possible use include exploratory, descriptive/visualisation, predictive or causal purposes) and areas of automation innovation including tools such as Celonis,Tableau etc is highly preferred.
